unit_learning_outcomes.description: Design and implement an online solution to demonstrate the importance of ICT in society.
Become familiar with the Microsoft Word Office suite.
Research and evaluate current and emerging ICT and information systems.
Analyse data to present information using relevant software applications.
Describe fundamental concepts and ideas related to information and communication technology (ICT) using discipline-specific terminology.
Explain the nature and function of ICT in society including security and ethical issues.

assessments.assessment_title: ICT Project  (Web development): Web design task; Presentation ; Reflective Report
assessments.description: In groups, students are required to research an ICT topic which is related to a current or emerging technology. Students should provide information on the description, applications, advantages, and disadvantages, as well as on the impacts on society of the chosen technology. They then need to present their research in the form of a website, that they create by using one of the free web authoring tools available online. They should also produce presentation slides containing diagrams, pictures, or supporting notes of sections of the website.
Students will follow instructions to prepare an Excel spreadsheet.
Students will follow instructions to prepare a .docx document.
Students will answer multiple choice, categorisation and short answer questions.

data.description: This unit provides a basic understanding of the role of information systems and technology in society, more specifically pertaining to today’s business environments. It builds on basic computer literacy skills to develop a level required for future tertiary studies. Students will gain elementary practical skills such as searching for, collecting, retrieving, managing and presenting information using relevant software applications. They will also examine key social and ethical issues associated with the use of information technology and information systems such as equity and access, privacy, freedom of information and copyright. Students will be required to engage in basic regular research and analysis of various topics relating to information systems and communication technology and to demonstrate a general understanding and evaluation of emerging technologies.
